intro: Boerhavia friesii, commonly known as the red-rooted sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its roots are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in dry environments. Boerhavia friesii is often found in sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
